page.title: 19Ecology < Flora >
page.content:
Plants include scrub-oak, birch, ash,mountain ash, hazel,alder,sloe and sycamore. There are conifers planted by the Forestry Commission. There is bracken, heather,gorse,bramble and bilberries,with sundew and butterwort.Primrose,violet,foxglove and bluebell are common. Globe flower,cuckoo-pint and wild orchid occur,and there are mosses,lichens, ferns and fungi in great variety.
Village Benefactor - Trefriw. Children, pregnant women and the elderly benefit from a trust set up in the l94Os by Henry Higgins. The trust subsidises a children's party at Christmas and provides a money gift to each child at birth.An annual gift of money to the elderly is another provision.It is administered by Gwynedd County Council.
